data.title: Great food!
data.text: My favorite there are the breakfast tacos!  They are HUGE!!  1 will fill you up.  Get it all the way & they will put everything in it!

data.title: Best Brisket in Sgar Land
data.text: Unassuming restaurant with the best brisket around.  Get some onion rings and spicy boba sauce and enjoy

data.title: "Great food and service
data.text: "Great food, wonderful service and averagely priced”    Friendly smiling staff very time I stop by the restaurant ....02/17/2016

data.title: Disappointing Brisket
data.text: I stopped in a few years ago to pick up Brisket to go.. it was busy so figured it was good but was disappointed

data.title: Good BBQ
data.text:
A good spot for some BBQ. Now I don't know if it's necessarily authentic because I'm a California girl. But the brisket and sausage links I had were delicious! Potato salad was also good and the beans were just ok. 

Their BBQ sauce is also unique. It was almost mole-like.

data.title: Good Breakfast
data.text: This place has really good BBQ.  I normally like to pick up a breakfast taco because they put so much in the taco you are full for hours and it is delicious.

data.title: Amazing Burgers
data.text: Best burger I've had in a long time.  Great place.  I'll be back.  Oh - the place is not much to look at but well worth investigating.

data.title: Don't waste your time or money.
data.text: I've driven past this place for years and finally decided to stop here for a bite.  Sorry I didn't keep driving.  The ribs were bland, the sausage tasted like the stuff you get at a grocery store, potato salad and beans were just plain yucky.

data.title: Yummy
data.text: Very good food and good portions for the money. The stuffed baked potatoe with brisket is a must try.

data.title: Texas BBQ with a long history!
data.text: Excellent hamburgers and hand cut fries. Breakfast on the weekends a great treat. BBQ is slow smoked. Open for 30 + years.

data.title: Horrible bland food
data.text: Food is very bland and way overpriced. Will never eat here again. Save your money and eat elsewhere. Last time for me.

data.title: I had the 2-meat platter (chicken and ribs) - which was really good
data.text: Reasonable prices and nice informal atmosphere.  I had beans and potato salad as sides and enjoyed them.  You get a lot of meat for your money.

data.title: Great potato!
data.text:
One of the best chopped beef potatoes I have ever had. I've been to places like Rudy's and Pappa's and walked out very disappointed, paying about the same and getting very little, but that was not the case here.

I was very impressed with the food and the brisket po-boy (finally a bbq place that gives you a sandwich on something other than cheap  sliced bread). Great bbq sauce (better than pappas), atmosphere and very friendly service.  They will receive my business again.

data.title: can't beat their meat!
data.text: Our family of 4 ordered 3 Texas Taters and had more than enough to eat. We took leftovers home. Great view by the river before the dam.

data.title: Great barbeque
data.text:
I was visiting family in the Houston area over the holidays and it was suggested by some native Sugar Landers in the fam that we meet up at one of their favorite eateries called the Texas Briskett because they wanted me ( a Seattle guy) to experience some great Texas barbecue.   

They said  it was a hole in the wall type place but the food was wonderful.   I've always had good luck with these kind of restaurants.  I have had some of the best Mexican food ever at hole in the walls that my son and his wife have introduced me to in Southern California. 

So to say I was looking forward to this dining experience is putting it mildly.  Yeah, my mouth was watering when we pulled up in front of the Texas Brisket right there in that strip mall across from the old Imperial Sugar Factory. 

First impressions of the place:

Clean...(clean goes a long way with me. ) 
No table cloths. 
Friendly staff.
Menu prices that I'd say were pretty darn reasonable.
 
Not your Conde Nostey fancy, smancy,  high overhead, high priced place.  

No way. Not the TB. Instead you get what you come for  ....order at the counter while you watch em carve up that scrumptious , juicy,  brisket., and then haul your ribs, chicken, beef, jalapenos, sliced onions and pickles to your table armed with plenty of napkins of course and dig in. 

Everybody was having a fun time as I admired my grandaughter's husband seated opposite me who was working on one of the  biggest baked potatoes I'd ever seen topped with a big hunk of brisket.  

Everything was so good and I know what Dan, who recommended TB, was talking about when me said Texas Brisket was great  barbecue.  I second that motion. By the way he is a gormet chef himself.

All I can say is the next time I find myself in Sugar Land you can be sure I will not spare the horses in making every effort to visit this outstanding eating establishment again.

data.title: Small Hometown barbecue done right
data.text: You have to keep your eyes open or you might pass this place but its worth it. Their smoked brisket is wonderful and juicy. They dont have much selection so be prepared to choose from a barbecued meat and about 6 vegetables. But the barbecue was still really great! Their stuffed baked potatoe was humongous . And they were very friendly and accomodating. The deco is very plain jane , dont expect some perfect place , but the food is worth the drive.

data.title: Time to recall
data.text: I was a little disappointed that they removed the HHHHHHHot sauce offerings but the food quality and quanity was above average and the price was inline. Service is better but the wait is less than others.

data.title: Mediocre BBQ
data.text: Located across from the former Imperial Sugar Factory and just minutes from the soon to open Sugar Land Skeeters Constellation Field this Sugar Land landmark is showing its age. It's a real hole in the wall and easy to miss. It's really dingy and the linoleum is wearing thin. We ordered the beef brisket plate, which was a very full portion and tasted fine. We forgot to tell them to put the sauce on the side, so the meat was slathered with it. We also ordered brisket to go and should have watched them slice it . When I got it home, the top layer looked nice, but the mound of what looked like  fat that had been trimmed off other brisket slabs was underneath. That little action is what got them the 2 star rating and my pledge to never return.
